events.originalText: Shortly after takeoff from Taipei Songshan Airport, the crew of TransAsia Airways Flight 235 shut down the wrong engine in response to a flameout, leading to a crash that resulted in 43 deaths.
events.subtitle: Songshan Airport
events.headline: TransAsia Airways Flight 235 crew shut down wrong engine, leading to crash with 43 deaths

events.originalText: The London low emission zone, governing what types of vehicles may enter Greater London, came into operation.
events.subtitle: London low emission zone
events.headline: London low emission zone now in effect for Greater London

events.originalText: The Panamanian-flagged freighter New Carissa ran aground near Coos Bay, Oregon, causing one of the worst oil spills in the state's history.
events.subtitle: Flag of convenience
events.headline: Panamanian-flagged freighter New Carissa causes major oil spill near Coos Bay, Oregon

events.originalText: Amadou Diallo, a 23-year-old immigrant from Guinea, was shot and killed by four New York City Police Department plain-clothed officers, prompting outrage both within and outside the city.
events.subtitle: Killing of Amadou Diallo
events.headline: Amadou Diallo shot and killed by NYPD officers, sparking outrage

events.originalText: An earthquake registering 5.9 MW struck northern Afghanistan, triggering landslides that killed over 2,300 people and destroyed around 15,000 homes.
events.subtitle: February 1998 Afghanistan earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake in northern Afghanistan triggers landslides, killing over 2,300 people

events.originalText: The Provisional Irish Republican Army bombed a motor coach carrying off-duty British Armed Forces personnel and their family members, killing twelve people.
events.subtitle: Provisional Irish Republican Army
events.headline: IRA bombing kills twelve off-duty British Armed Forces personnel

events.originalText: American newspaper heiress and socialite Patty Hearst was kidnapped by the Symbionese Liberation Army, which she later joined, in one of the most well-known cases of Stockholm syndrome.
events.subtitle: Patty Hearst
events.headline: Patty Hearst kidnapped by Symbionese Liberation Army

events.originalText: Yasser Arafat (pictured) was elected chairman of the Palestine Liberation Organization.
events.subtitle: Yasser Arafat
events.headline: Yasser Arafat elected chairman of Palestine Liberation Organization

events.originalText: World War II: U.S. forces liberated the Santo Tomas Internment Camp in Manila, the largest Japanese internment camp in the Philippines.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: U.S. forces liberate Santo Tomas Internment Camp in Manila

events.originalText: The Philippine–American War began when an American soldier, under orders to keep insurgents away from his unit's encampment, fired on a Filipino soldier in Manila.
events.subtitle: Philippine–American War
events.headline: Philippine-American War begins with American soldier firing on Filipino soldier

events.originalText: Chilean War of Independence: Chilean forces captured the city of Valdivia.
events.subtitle: Chilean War of Independence
events.headline: Chilean forces capture city of Valdivia in War of Independence

events.originalText: John Marshall, whose court opinions helped lay the basis for U.S. constitutional law and made the Supreme Court a coequal branch of government, took office as chief justice.
events.subtitle: John Marshall
events.headline: John Marshall takes office as chief justice, shaping U.S. constitutional law

events.originalText: The Riobamba earthquake, the most powerful in Ecuador's history, devastated Riobamba and many other cities, causing at least 6,000 casualties.
events.subtitle: 1797 Riobamba earthquake
events.headline: Riobamba earthquake devastates Ecuador, causing at least 6,000 casualties

events.originalText: A strong earthquake struck the eastern coast of Sicily, causing at least 15,000 deaths.
events.subtitle: 1169 Sicily earthquake
events.headline: Strong earthquake hits eastern coast of Sicily, resulting in at least 15,000 deaths

events.originalText: Emperor Taizu (pictured) came to power, initiating the Song dynasty of China that eventually lasted for more than three centuries.
events.subtitle: Emperor Taizu of Song
events.headline: Emperor Taizu initiates Song dynasty in China, lasting over three centuries
